intro: Salvia pratensis var. modesta, commonly known as the modest blue sage, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces spikes of small, tubular blue to purple flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. It is often found in meadows and along streambanks, where it plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
